parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.
Justly, righteously. Adverb from dikaios; equitably.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From apo and lambano; to receive; also to take aside.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural

str2: Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.
(lit: out of place, unusual, unbecoming), improper, unrighteous, perverse. Out of place, i.e. improper, injurious, wicked.
